source: This power can be activated during a rest

A typical creature in the game world has an alignment, which broadly describes its moral and personal attitudes. Alignment is a combination of two factors: one identifies morality (good, evil, or neutral), and the other describes attitudes toward society and order (lawful, chaotic, or neutral).
Taking acid damage each turn until the effect ends.
Advantage on Constitution saving throws against poison.
-1 penalty on attack rolls, saving throws and ability checks. Complete a long rest to reduce the penalty.
-2 penalty on attack rolls, saving throws and ability checks. Complete a long rest to reduce the penalty.
-3 penalty on attack rolls, saving throws and ability checks. Complete a long rest to reduce the penalty.
-4 penalty on attack rolls, saving throws and ability checks. Complete a long rest to reduce the penalty.
The creature's Armor Class becomes at least 16.
Advantage on Wisdom and death saving throws; healing restores maximum possible hit points.
Cannot see anything; disadvantage on attacks; attacks against the creature have advantage.
Advantage on Dexterity saving throws and reduced falling damage.
Incapacitated and speed is 0, until wounded or awoken.
Cannot gain hit points. If undead, disadvantage on attacking the caster.
If this character dies, the game is over.
Must make a WIS saving throw to act.
Disadvantage to attack roll against caster.
Disadvantage on CHA saving throws and ability checks.
Disadvantage on CON saving throws and ability checks.
Caster's attacks and spells against the target deal an extra 1d8 necrotic damage.
Disadvantage on DEX saving throws and ability checks.
Disadvantage on INT saving throws and ability checks.
Disadvantage on STR saving throws and ability checks.
Disadvantage on WIS saving throws and ability checks.
See normally in dim light, and in natural darkness as if in dim light.
Cannot take reactions and has -2 Armor Class penalty.
Cannot act until revived or resurrected.
Detected as aberration, celestial, elemental, fey, fiend, or undead.
Immune to cold damage and regain HP from cold.
Immune to lightning damage and regain HP from lightning.
Immune to fire damage and regain HP from fire.
The creature is afflicted with a disease.
The creature's type and position are known to the caster of this effect.
Half damage on STR based attacks.
Can dash as a bonus action.
Target creature gains a flying speed of 12 cells per move action.
Impose disadvantage on the target's next saving throw.
Removes all occurrences of these conditions: {0}.
Removes one random occurrence of these conditions: {0}.
Unable to approach the source of fear, disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.
Must run away from the source of fear.
Speed is doubled; +2 AC; Dexterity saving throws have advantage; able to take one more action per turn (Attack, Dash, Dodge, Disengage, Hide, Use Item).

Speed is reduced by 4.
Disadvantage to attack rolls.
+1 to AC; +1 to attack and damage; +1 to all saving throws.
Creature cannot benefit from invisibility, attackers have advantage.
Unable to take actions or reactions.

The creature has to make a successful CON saving to act on its turn.
Vision is heavily obscured.
Cannot be seen without magic; creature has advantage on attacks; attackers have disadvantage.
The creature cannot move or take any action until after its next turn.
The target creature hovers; caster can move it up or down.
Maximum hit points are reduced until a long rest is completed.
Base Armor Class is set to 13.
Weapon can wound enemies that are immune to non-magical attacks.
Emits light; cannot become invisible; revealed if invisible.
Receives +1d6 damage when hit by the caster.
Sustains continuous fire damage unless the fire is extinguished by an action.
Unable to act; attacks against creature have advantage; automatic critical hit if attacked from a neighboring cell.
Turned into stone; can hardly be hurt.
Disadvantage on attacks and ability checks.
Can only move by crawling; vulnerable to close attacks.
Unable to move; creature's attacks and Dexterity saving throws have disadvantage; attacks against creature have advantage.
Armor Class increases by +5 and immunity to magic missile.
Difficult terrain; can fall prone; heavily obscured; must roll concentration check.
Speed halved; -2 to AC and DEX saves; max one action or bonus action; no reaction; max one attack per turn; spellcasting can fail.
Able to climb like a spider.
Speed is halved; can sustain damage at the start of each turn.
The character is currently protected by Spirit Guardians.
Unable to act or move; attacks against creatures have advantage; automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws.
Unable to act for one round.
First attack against this creature has advantage.
The creature gains temporary hit points.
Damage of evocation spells increases by proficiency bonus and INT bonus.
Caster has advantage on his first attack against the spell's target.
Can perform a vampiric melee spell attack each turn.
Spell up to level {0} automatically dispelled, DC {1}+ spell level otherwise.
Extinguishes light sources in the area.
Spell up to level {0} automatically countered, DC {1}+ spell level otherwise.
The corrosive spray of a black dragon's breath and the dissolving enzymes secreted by a black pudding deal acid damage.
Blunt force attacks - hammers, falling, constriction, and the like - deal bludgeoning damage.
The infernal chill radiating from an ice devil's spear and the frigid blast of a white dragon's breath deal cold damage.
Red dragons breathe fire, and many spells conjure flames to deal fire damage.
Force is pure magical energy focused into a damaging form. Most effects that deal force damage are spells, including magic missile and spiritual weapon.
A lightning bolt spell and a blue dragon's breath deal lightning damage.
Necrotic damage, dealt by certain undead and spells such as chill touch, withers matter and even the soul.
Puncturing and impaling attacks, including spears and monster bites, deal piercing damage.
Venomous stings and the toxic gas of a green dragon's breath deal poison damage.
Radiant damage, dealt by a cleric's flame strike spell or an angel's smiting weapon, sears the flesh like fire and overloads the spirit with power.
Swords, axes, and monsters' claws deal slashing damage.
A concussive burst of sound, such as the effect of the thunderwave spell, deals thunder damage.
Reveals all the properties of an item.
Senses the presence of creature types: {0}.
Reveals creatures or objects which are {0}.
Until the end of the source character's turn.
Until the end of this character's turn.
Until the start of the source character's turn.
Until the start of this character's turn.

if attacker has a conscious ally next to the target:

Recover half your class level (rounded up) of spells slots up to level {0}.
This area slows down those who walk through it.
Creatures in this area cannot see anything.
This area hurts those who walk through it.
Appears to relieve the Soraks of their vulnerability to light.
Disadvantage on concentration until next turn.
For the duration of the spell, you can sense poisonous creatures and disease within 6 cells of you.
This beast will be charmed for the spell's duration, or until you or one of your companions harms it.

You ward a creature within range against attack. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack or harmful spell must make a Wisdom saving throw or choose another target.
You are warded until the spell ends or until you cast a spell or launch an attack.
This animal has been conjured by another creature.
Can read and speak any language.
Resistance to Cold, Fire, and Lightning damage.
The target creature gains a flying speed of 6 cells per move action.
Insufficient STR for this heavy armor. Speed is reduced by 2.
Attacks on this creature have disadvantage as long as it is conscious and able to move. Ceases to function until the next turn if damaged.
Creature's vision is heavily obscured; disadvantage on attack rolls; attack rolls against creature have disadvantage.
This creature has been conjured by a magical effect
The creatures takes 1D6 necrotic damage at the beginning of its turn.
The creature does not emit any sound and cannot speak or cast spells with a verbal component.

Aberrations, celestials, elementals, feys, fiends, and undead have disadvantage to attack the target, and cannot charm, frighten, or possess it. If the target is already charmed, frightened, or possessed by such a creature, the target has advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.
Advantage on the next attack with a bow this turn.
Cannot be seen without magic; the creature has advantage on attacks; attackers have disadvantage. The creature remains invisible even when attacking and casting spells.
Resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing damage.
The creature is frightened and receives psychic damage each turn until it succeeds on a saving throw.
Resistant to cold and retaliates with fire damage against melee attackers.
Resistant to fire and retaliates with cold damage against melee attackers.
When reduced to 0 hit points, HP is set to 1 instead, preventing instant death from massive damage or effects.
At the start of this turn, the creature can move away, not act at all, melee attack a target within reach, or act normally.

The creature is removed from the game for the duration of the spell, unless the spell is broken before then. If the spell remains unbroken for its entire duration, the creature is permanently banished if it is extraplanar (celestial, fiend, elemental).
The creature must use its action to randomly attack a creature within its reach if possible.
The creature must move in a random direction.
The creature cannot do anything due to its confusion.
You get +3 AC until the end of the attacker's turn.
You get +3 AC until the end of the attacker's turn.
Your ranged weapon attacks have no disadvantage or advantage, no matter the conditions.
Your movement speed is increased by 3 cells and your AC is reduced by 2 until the start of your turn.
Celestial, elementals, feys, fiends, and undead have disadvantage on attacks against you. You can also cancel a hostile enchantment or dismiss an extraplanar creature hit by one of your attacks.
The creature is joining the controlling caster.
The creature's actions are totally controlled by the caster.
Take 1d3 acid damage at the end of your turn for 3 turns.
The creature has the ability to cast spells.
The creature is indifferent towards enemies unless it is wounded.
The creature cannot be charmed or frightened.
Your attack spells dice deal at least average damage.
+10 DEX (Stealth) while you are standing against a wall.
Target creature is killed if its challenge rating is {0} or lower.
Target creature is killed if its remaining hit points are equal to {0} or lower.
Cannot act and takes 6d6 acid damage each turn. A single attack of 30 damage can force the swallower to regurgitate.
Cannot be frightened and regains temporary hit points every turn
Allied creatures affected by the spell automatically succeed their saving throw
Doubles the range of a spell or change the range of a touch spell to 30 feet
All damage dice rolls of 1 or 2 are rerolled, keeping the new result
Doubles the duration of spell lasting 1 minute or more, to a maximum of 24 hours
Can force a creature to roll the saving throw with disadvantage
Can cast a main action spell with a bonus action instead, though you can't cast another spell during the same turn, except for cantrips.
Can cast a sepll without verbal or somatic component
If the source spell targets one creature only, this adds another target
Recover sorcery points up to half your sorcerer level, rounded up
Enemies have disadvantage on attack rolls made against you and you gain advantage on saving throws, until the beginning of your next turn
The creature requires a Resurrection or similar effect to be revived
Maximum hit points reduced for an hour or until an effect which cures diseases affects the target
Immune to poison and being frightened, advantage to WIS saves and current and max hit points increased by 10
Disadvantage to attack rolls and ability checks
Must run away from the source of the effect
